trends: There have been 22 other sightings in Lancaster
There were no other sightings in Lancaster on or around May 13th 2010
divs: sighting details while talking on the phone in my screenroom i observed north of my location a c-130 (grey color-military i assume) pursuing a small bright object, both traveling west to east, maybe the east southeast. c-130's fly over almost every night. usually in pairs. they had already flown over from west to east earlier in the evening, at approx. 20:00 hrs. but this single aircraft was going much faster than the usual flyovers. about 1-2 seconds ahead of the c-130 was a very small, very bright object traveling in a perfect straight line. the speed varied, very fast, then slower, it repeated this pattern across the entire skyline: fast\slower, fast\slower. even at the slower speed the 2 were flying very fast! the c-130 was traveling at a constant speed. in my opinion the c-130 was close to being maxed out in speed and manueverability. after all it is a cargo plane. the small bright object veered toward the right (south) as it neared the eastern horizon. as did the aircraft in pursuit. they both disappeared into clouds. i could not see any details on the bright object, it was too small, and too bright. the 2 were north of new providence, maybe over willow street, and strasburg. maybe over route 30. then probably chester county, pa. the object was under intelligent control. the brightness varied i think with the speed. there was no exhaust or vapor trail. the bright light was constant, no variation. first i thought it was a meteorite but it had no trail, no sparks or smoke, and didn't head toward the ground, it traveled parallel to the ground. the object was very small compared to the c-130. if it wasn't so bright the object may have been impossible to see. the plane was at least 75-maybe as much as 100- times bigger. the whole thing happened in just a minute or so. the weather was partly cloudy, with a 5-10 mph southeast wind. i emailed the local tv station (wgal 8), and got no response. i don't know if anyone else saw this. it's hard to believe no one saw it, the object was so bright. with a big military plane in pursuit. it wasn't swamp gas, or a weather balloon i know that! respectfully submitted; [cmsw\tg\pid]
